title: Fears Sparked Over Lithium-Ion Batteries After Suspected E-Scooter Fire | 10 News+
description: The risks of lithium-ion batteries are in the national discourse once again after a fire in Central Queensland claimed the lives of four people. Detectives suspect an e-scooter battery may be behind the tragedy. Firefighters in New South Wales say lithium-ion batteries have become one of the state’s fastest-growing fire risks. title: Melbourne Community Pantry Heroes, Sussan Ley Slammed By Colleague, Battery Fire Fears | 10 News+
description: A small but passionate group of volunteers are keeping shelves stocked at the ‘Food is Free’ community pantry in Melbourne’s south-east. Naomi Walsh, who first set up the cupboard outside her home in 2016, says it operates on a “Give what you can, take what you can use” philosophy. The pop-up pantry which serves those in need has become so popular that it now also acts as a free street library and nursery.  Sussan Ley has been publicly slammed by her own colleague, Victorian Senator Sarah Henderson, who says the Opposition Leader is “losing support”. Henderson wants the Liberals to join the Nationals in ditching their net zero by 2050 policy, when the party decides its position next week. Ley refused to respond, saying she should not be expected to “comment on commentary”.  The risks of lithium-ion batteries are in the national discourse once again after a fire in Central Queensland claimed the lives of four people. Detectives suspect an e-scooter battery may be behind the tragedy. Firefighters in New South Wales say lithium-ion batteries have become one of the state’s fastest-growing fire risks. title: Former Prince Andrew Summoned By US Congress Over Ties To Epstein | 10 News+
description: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor, the former British prince, has been summoned to appear before a US Congress panel that is investigating convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. A letter has been sent to the disgraced royal requesting him to submit himself to questioning, over his “well-documented friendship” with Epstein. Andrew has until November 20 to respond. title: Typhoon Kalmaegi Batters Vietnam After Killing Nearly 200 In The Philippines | 10 News
description: Typhoon Kalmaegi has left a trail of devastation across the Philippines and Vietnam, killing at least 193 people and leaving more than a hundred missing.  The storm tore through central Vietnam with winds of up to 149km/h, uprooting trees, ripping roofs from homes and forcing mass evacuations as hundreds of thousands sought shelter.  In the Philippines, torrential rain triggered deadly floods and landslides that wiped out entire neighbourhoods and buried homes under mud, prompting a nationwide state of calamity.  Relief operations are now underway across both countries, with Vietnam’s prime minister vowing that “no one should be left hungry or cold” as the weakened storm moves toward Cambodia and Laos. title: World's Largest Spider Web Discovered In Cave
description: Arachnophobes beware, scientists have found what could be the world’s largest spider web, stretching more than 100 square metres inside a cave on the Greek–Albanian border.  The Sulfur Cave web houses around 110,000 spiders from two newly identified species, the first time these usually solitary creatures have been seen living together.  Researchers describe the discovery as “extraordinary,” suggesting the colony thrives thanks to an endless supply of midges deep underground.  For now, the record-breaking web, and its many-legged residents, are thankfully staying put underground. title: US Flight Chaos Worsens As Unpaid Aviation Staff Call In Sick During Shutdown | 10 News
description: There’s chaos in the skies across America, with the government shutdown forcing the cancellation of thousands of flights.  Airport staffing is under pressure because aviation workers who haven't been paid for a month, are calling in sick to work second jobs to make ends meet.   The disruption stretches from coast to coast and is expected to get worse heading into Thanksgiving.
